page.title: 01OUR D-BLOCK
page.content: Our D-block is a rural area.We have four villages in the D-block,one large village called Howden,Hunwick, a medium village and two smaller ones, High Grange and North Bitchburn.The block is covered mainly with farmland - mostly grass.The River Wear just touches the edge of the block.There are quite a few farms & farmshouses and the main Bp.Auckland-Crook &Bp.Auckland-Willington roads.The villages grew up when coal was discovered in the 19th Century.Thus most of the houses are terraced,built for the miners.The mines had all closed by 1940 and as there is little industry,most people have to travel to the nearby towns for work,as they do to visit cinemas,theatres,sports centres,shops and banks.
